sourcing.instructions: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supplier specializing in alkali metals. Na: Purchase from a chemical supply company. Nb: Source from a provider of transition metals. Rb: Available through chemical distributors. Se: Obtain from a supplier of non-metals.
steps: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supplier specializing in alkali metals. Na: Purchase from a chemical supply company. Nb: Source from a provider of transition metals. Rb: Available through chemical distributors. Se: Obtain from a supplier of non-metals.

1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using an analytical balance. 2. Combine Cs, Na, Nb, Rb, and Se in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture into a fine powder, ensuring uniformity. 4. Transfer the powdered mixture to a ceramic crucible for heating.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using an analytical balance. 2. Combine Cs, Na, Nb, Rb, and Se in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture into a fine powder, ensuring uniformity. 4. Transfer the powdered mixture to a ceramic crucible for heating.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat the mixture gradually to 800°C at a rate of 5°C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to promote full reaction and solidification of the material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat the mixture gradually to 800°C at a rate of 5°C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to promote full reaction and solidification of the material.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature (approximately 25°C) naturally. 2. Avoid opening the furnace door until it has cooled completely to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature (approximately 25°C) naturally. 2. Avoid opening the furnace door until it has cooled completely to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance stability and surface integrity if required. 4. Store the final product in a dry environment to prevent moisture absorption.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance stability and surface integrity if required. 4. Store the final product in a dry environment to prevent moisture absorption.
